availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Tennessee governor, journalist and politician. Wythe County, Virginia native. Married to Eliza An Oâ€™Brien on August 5, 1836. Editor of the Knoxville Whig from 1839 to 1851. Unsuccessful Republican candidate for Congress in 1842. Political appointee as member of the Tennessee River Commission for the Improvement of Navigation by President Millard Fillmore. Elected as delegate to constitutional convention in Tennessee in 1864. Republican governor of Tennessee from 1865 to 1869.
